description: Automatically creates or updates test files when React components are modified
author: JSONbored
features: Automatic test file generation for React components
Support for both TypeScript and JavaScript
Jest and React Testing Library integration
useCases: Generate test files when creating new React components
Ensure every component has corresponding tests
Create render tests for component validation
Set up testing infrastructure for new components

faq.issue: Generated tests import components incorrectly using default export
faq.solution: Hook assumes default exports. For named exports, modify the template to use: import { ComponentName } from './file'. Check component export pattern before generation or add detection logic for export type.

faq.issue: Test file created but component requires props causing render failures
faq.solution: Base template uses empty props <Component />. Extract props interface from component file using grep and generate mock props: const mockProps = { required: 'value' }; before render() call in template.

faq.issue: Hook triggers on every component save creating test spam
faq.solution: Hook checks for existing test files but still logs output. Add conditional: if [ -f "$TEST_FILE" ]; then exit 0; fi before any echo statements to silently skip when tests exist.

faq.issue: Generated imports fail when @testing-library not installed in project
faq.solution: Hook doesn't verify testing dependencies. Add package.json check: grep -q '@testing-library/react' package.json || { echo 'Install testing libraries first'; exit 1; } before generating test files.

faq.issue: Component analysis grep patterns miss TypeScript-specific syntax
faq.solution: Patterns like 'interface.*Props' work for most cases. Enhance with: grep -E '(interface|type)\s+\w*Props' for better TypeScript detection. Add FC<Props> and React.FC pattern matching for comprehensive coverage.
